item.title: 17 Amazing Health Benefits of Lettuce
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
Egyptians were the first to cultivate lettuce (Lactuca sativa). It’s been utilized in Unani medicine for ages to cure a variety of diseases. This nutritious green leafy vegetable is high in antioxidants and critical minerals. Salads, sandwiches, soups, and wraps frequently feature it. item.title: Top 15 Health Benefits of White Pumpkin
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
The vegetable pumpkin is a gourd-like squash belonging to the Cucurbita genus and Cucurbitae family. Pumpkins are commonly used to make pumpkin pie, which is a classic Thanksgiving dish in the United States. item.title: 10 Vegetables That Help You Grow Taller

item.description:

item.title: 18 Amazing Celery Benefits And Side Effects
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
Celery is an herbaceous plant of the parsley family ( Apiaceae) and its stalks and leaves are used to flavor soups and stocks. It is low in calories, has high water content, and is used as a low-carb snack option. Celery is native to Mediterranean and North African areas but is now cultivated globally. item.title: 23 Amazing Health And Beauty Benefits of Black Radish
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
Black radish or the Black Spanish Radish or Erfurter Radish is a root vegetable that belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is a variety of radish. This edible root has black skin but white flesh and is available in both round and elongated varieties.
